description: Number of ordered pairs of partitions of n with no common parts.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
Sylvie Corteel, Carla D. Savage, Herbert S. Wilf, Doron Zeilberger, A pentagonal number sieve, J. Combin. Theory Ser. A 82 (1998), no. 2, 186-192.
H. S. Wilf, A pentagonal number sieve (with Sylvie Corteel, Carla Savage and Doron Zeilberger)
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Pentagonal Number Theorem
formula: G.f.: Sum[p(n)^2x^n]/Sum[p(n)x^n], with p(n)=number of partitions of n.
example: a(3)=4 because of the 4 pairs of partitions of 3: (3,21),(3,111),(21,3),(111,3).
maple: with(combinat): p1 := sum(numbpart(n)^2*x^n, n=0..500): it := p1*product((1-x^i), i=1..500): s := series(it, x, 500): for i from 0 to 100 do printf(`%d,`,coeff(s,x,i)) od:
prog: (Haskell)a054440 = sum . zipWith (*) a087960_list . map a001255 . a260672_row-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 15 2015
author: Herbert Wilf (wilf(AT)math.upenn.edu), May 13 2000
extensions: Corrected and extended by _James A. Sellers_, May 23 2000
